result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Steven Elliott

records.addlTxt: Failed to comply with bond conditions. TO BE HELD FOR APPEARANCE IN BRANCH 1 ONLY. Signed by SJN on 10/12/22. c: SCSO w/ complaint, ec: Attys. kma

2:21 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Ronald Steven Elliott. Defendant Ronald Steven Elliott not in court. Set for Hearing. Atty. Perrin is unaware of DE's whereabouts. ADA Ellenwood requests continuance of jury trial and notes Atty. Perrin's objection. Court removes jury trial and FPT from court calendar based on DE's non-appearance. Court amends current warrant to include non-appearance, to be held for appearance in Branch 1 only. Adjourned: 2:53 PM. kma

of Absconder Status. Filed by JSC Shelby H. arc      Per SJN, please prepare warrant for bond violation. Body only. Adjoining states.
22R 012451.  $500 paid by Nany S. cah
Request for Release/ Modification/ Change in Sentence, filed by DE. Includes 22CF79 & 22CF424. Per SJN on 9/2/22- DENIED. JA copied DE. bph

Letter from ADA Ellenwood requesting continuance of 12/6/22 JT.  Per SJN, if no objection from Atty Perrin, remove JT and FPT and reset w/attys and lab.  kp/gll  09/13/22 Atty Perrin Objects. Per SRN, set Hearing. arc
Per SJN.  Faxed: Dispatch, Jail, & SCSO. bph

- AMENDED

- Includes 22CF79 & 22CF424

- $1000 already posted, DE to post additional $500 before release. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device [restrictions] prior to release. 

- I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. 

- I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center.  If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- No use or possession of a firearm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Amanda T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

02:46 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Bela Alexander Ballo, DF ATTY: Shirlene Renee Perrin, DF: Ronald Steven Elliott appears in court. INCLUDES 22CF79 and 22TR394. Court reviews file. Atty. Perrin states that DE is running late. RECESS to allow time for DE to appear. 2:57 PM - Case recalled. Court reviews pre-trial bond report from JSC and questions DE regarding uncharged GPS device. DE responds. Atty. Perrin gives reasoning for previous non-appearance. Court will increase bond by $500 if GPS goes uncharged again. Court sets FPT and JT. Court notes resolution deadline 14 days prior to trial. Supplemental pre-trial submissions to be filed one week prior to trial. Representative from JSC states that DE has not been in compliance with testing. Court orders DE to test at JSC today, if DE tests positive, DE to be taken into custody. Adjourned: 3:10 PM. kma  Jury trial scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:02 PM  CO: Nordstrand, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: K Kittel.  ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Ronald Steven Elliott appeared from jail. Court. Attys argue bond modificaiton. Atty Perrin notes there is no longer a warrant out of MN, willing to be put on GPS. Court questions as to out of state GPS. DE has been in custody in SCC since 2/9/22.  OFF RECORD:  1:10 pm.  BACK ON:  1:13 pm.  Atty Ellenwood spoke with JSC, GPS is able to be done, harder to monitor across state lines. Deputy Sykora notes a warrant in Hennepin Co, non-extraditable. Court amends bond, DE must be in person for FPT or JT will be cancelled due to non compliance. Adjourned: 1:22 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on April 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
